alert.note: Alert for Broward; Miami-Dade (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 29 at 4:46PM EDT until May 29 at 8:15PM EDT by NWS Miami
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of South Florida, including the following counties, Broward and Miami-Dade. * WHEN...Until 645 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 443 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to slow moving thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen with these thunderstorms during the last hour. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are expected over the area with these slow moving storms. The Miami Lakes have also received around 2 inches of rainfall from early thunderstorms and additional rainfall will continue to cause minor flooding over this area. Rest of the advisory area could see minor flooding shortly. If the rainfall amounts increase more than forecast, then a flash flood warning may be needed for portions of the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Miami, Hialeah, Pembroke Pines, Miramar, Miami Beach, Coral Gables, South Miami, Surfside, Miami Gardens, Kendall, North Miami, Doral, North Miami Beach, Miami Lakes, Hialeah Gardens, Opa-Locka, Miami Springs, Sweetwater, Miami Shores and North Bay Village. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
